question: What is the name of the Moon-landing Mission of the NASA, for which it has chosen the first-ever woman?
explanation:
NASA has named the 18 astronauts group half of them being women, who will train for its Moon-landing Mission by 2024, named ‘Artemis’.
From this set of astronauts, the first woman to set foot on the moon and the next man on the moon will be picked up. The group includes Christina Koch and Jessica Meir, who performed the world's first all-female spacewalk.
